intro: Arthrochilus dockrillii, commonly known as the Dockrill's orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces strikingly beautiful, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It blooms during the cooler months, usually between June and September. Arthrochilus dockrillii is a rare and protected species, found in specific habitats along the south-western coast of Western Australia.
